definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
lit. on hearing wind, to say rain/to agree uncritically with whatever people say/to parrot other people's words/to chime in with others
pinyin: ting1 jian4 feng1 jiu4 shi4 yu3

sentences.english: Bll the boys laughed to hear the good news.
sentences.chinese: 聽見這個好動靜然後，所有的男孩都笑了。

sentences.english: She was often heared humming this song.
sentences.chinese: 人們常聽見她哼這首歌。

sentences.english: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見了許多人的讒謗，四圍都是驚嚇。

sentences.english: I heard Heidi breathe deeply, but she said nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見了海蒂清晰的呼吸聲，但她什麼也沒有說。

sentences.english: I still heard them even in Asian dens and German gutters.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然聽見了他們甚而在亞洲穴和德國天溝。

sentences.english: I hear the song of the nightingales, and I smell crushed mulberries.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見夜鶯的歌聲，我聞到壓碎的桑葚味道。

sentences.english: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
sentences.chinese: 你們聽見有話說，當愛你的鄰舍，恨你的仇敵。

sentences.english: See what they spew from their mouths- they spew out swords from their lips, and they say, 'Who can hear us?'
sentences.chinese: 他們口中噴吐惡言，嘴裏有刀，他們說有誰聽見。

sentences.english: I hear the elder sisters read aloud in the ruins
sentences.chinese: 我聽見廢墟里姐姐的書聲朗朗。

sentences.english: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
sentences.chinese: 他們口中噴吐惡言，嘴裏有刀，他們說有誰聽見。

sentences.english: When his disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?
sentences.chinese: 門徒聽見這話，就希奇得很，說，這樣誰能得救呢。

sentences.english: Each time I hear Mr. Goh singing, already I know that he has drunk alot.
sentences.chinese: 每次我聽見高先生唱歌，就知道他喝了很多酒。

sentences.english: It was in the course of his reading that Magnus caught the sound of his name.
sentences.chinese: 曼克奈斯就在他念的當兒，聽見了自己的名字。

sentences.english: But I really heard someone steal.
sentences.chinese: 但我真聽見有人在偷東西。

sentences.english: I was irritated to hear her sing the same song.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見她唱老調就很生氣。

sentences.english: All the people can hear the birds singing.

definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
